summary: Jacqueline Hess was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list her name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates within the SCAS. The consistent appearance of her name across these payroll documents indicates her employment with the committee during the specified period.
significance: Jacqueline Hess's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, her presence on payroll and certification reports confirms her involvement in the SCAS's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
